I’m happy at home
 (I’m happy, happy at home)

Drummer Roger Taylor reportedly despised this line. Brian May recounts the argument surrounding it with amusement; “That line; ‘happy at home’, I can remember Roger going "I don’t want that f-cking line! We’re not gonna sing ‘happy at home’ for f-ck’s sake- this is rock n' roll!”

Whenever this world is cruel to me
 I got you to help me forgive

A very interesting and true facet of love – the ability to make your loved one get over anger, frustration, disappointments.

Probably quite prevalent within a successful rock band, with different strong personalities (especially with Freddie Mercury) vying for a role.
Rather than a fade out, this short exit “builds up”, ending an uplifting song on a “high” note.
The ever present Brian May’s signature guitar solo, albeit quite short, enriched by the backing piano.

Ooh, I’ve been wandering ’round (’round)
 But still come back to you

These lines are a double entendre. The “wandering” most likely refers to the extensive travelling required from a successful rock band, and Queen did their share.

It can also mean straying from loyalty and faithfulness, something that was very prevalent since the early promiscuous days of rock.

This statement, and the whole song, is as a strong loving statement as they come. It also held true, as the lyricist, John Deacon, has been married to the same woman for 45 years, as of January 18th, 2020.

While simple on the surface, “You make me live” can represent multiple statements: ‘you make me alive’; life is not worth it without you; you encourage, push me to do and be my best; you are my creator, and more.

The intro consists of a short piano lead in – played by both Freddy Mercury (live) and John Deacon (studio) – on the electric piano, which Mercury despised.

Freddie Mercury said:

I refused to play the damn thing (the Wurlitzer). It’s tiny and horrible and I don’t like them. Why play those things when you’ve got a lovely superb grand piano? No, I think, basically what he [John] is trying to say is it was the desired effect.
